bibl.title: Letter from Theodore L. Bliss to Philip Showalter Hench, November 22, 1941

div1.p: Bliss thanks Hench for the reprint of his yellow fever article and jokes that Hench should have been carrying or wearing a sun helmet in the article's illustration.

div1.head: Letter from Theodore L. Bliss to Philip Showalter Hench, November 22, 1941
div1.opener:
THEODORE L. BLISS, M. D.
428 OHIO BUILDING
AKRON, OHIO
----
FRANKLIN 3313
November 22, 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Phil,
div1.p:
I was very happy to get a re-
print of your Yellow Fever article.
The illustration of you before the
original building in Cuba is quite
complete except, it grieves me sore-
ly to see that you did not carry at
least in your hand a sun helmet.
Why Phil, you might have had a sun
stroke! Thanks again, with our love
to all your family I am,
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, T. L. Bliss, M. D. TLB:AB
